senses.sense_definition: The process of inoculating a fresh subject or medium with material taken from an already inoculated source.

examples.text: The researchers confirmed the presence of the virus through the <w>subinoculation</w> of infected blood into healthy tissue.
Successful <w>subinoculation</w> requires sterile conditions to prevent contamination of the new culture.

senses.sense_definition: The material or substance used to perform a secondary inoculation.

examples.text: The scientist prepared the <w>subinoculation</w> carefully to ensure the bacterial strain remained pure for the next phase.
Any contamination of the <w>subinoculation</w> could compromise the results of the entire experiment.
